meanings.definition: The quality of being pleasant or agreeable.
meanings.sent1: Her likableness made everyone enjoy her company.
meanings.sent2: The puppy's likableness was evident in the way everyone wanted to pet him.
meanings.sent3: The likableness of the kitten was so irresistible that even the grumpiest person smiled.
meanings.sent4: His likableness shone through like a ray of sunshine on a cloudy day.
meanings.sent5: The likableness of the flowers in full bloom filled the garden with joy.

meanings.definition: The state or condition of being liked or favored by others.
meanings.sent1: The likableness of the popular student was evident in the number of friends surrounding him.
meanings.sent2: She was surprised by the sudden increase in her likableness after helping her classmates.
meanings.sent3: The likableness of the ice cream truck was so high that it always had a long line of customers.
meanings.sent4: His likableness in the office made him the go-to person for advice and support.
meanings.sent5: The likableness of the singer's voice captivated the audience and left them wanting more.
